text: the town of RL was the epicenter of this
region's once prosperous industry it's
hard to imagine just 40 years ago this
was a bustling fishing port till you'd
wanna cut material there was a beautiful
sea with waves coming up to the beach it
was wonderful
there were no fish in the Soviet Union
like the fish in RL we thought that
gradually life would get better the
rivers that fed the sea we diverted to
irrigate plantations created during the
Soviet era since the 1960's over 90
percent of the sea has disappeared
the exposed seabed extends for hundreds
of kilometers living ships marooned in
this newly created desert eight from the
World Bank has been used by the
government to build a dam at the seas
northernmost tip the dam is now at full
capacity and although it hasn't brought
the sea back to the town of RL it has
helped other local communities full
cotyledon Keesha by the late 90s only
eight houses were left in this village
out of 90 houses but when they built the
dam it improved people are coming from
all over the place and fishing here
here in era people are hopeful that one
day the sea will come back to their town
too and provide the future for their
children some people believe that the
sea will return others insist that it
will not may be my grandchildren's
grandchildren will see water here the
disappearance of the RLC was a tragedy
for the local people and one they are
still coming to terms with frost on
Kabul
BBC News
